articles.headline: Sudden Rise in Home Demand Takes Builders by Surprise
articles.snippet: As welcome as a long-awaited improvement in the American housing market may be, the unusually low level of homes for sale is creating problems for buyers and sellers alike.
articles.abstract: As welcome as a long-awaited improvement in the American housing market may be, the unusually low level of homes for sale is creating problems for buyers and sellers alike.
articles.lead_paragraph: SACRAMENTO — After six years of waiting on the sidelines, newly eager home buyers across the country are discovering that there are not enough houses for sale to accommodate the recent flush of demand.

articles.headline: Chemicals Would Be ‘Game Changer’ in Syria, Obama Says
articles.snippet: President Obama’s remarks represented both an effort to warn Syria’s government of the consequences of using its chemical arsenal and to signal support for Israel, the main point of his trip there.
articles.abstract: President Obama’s remarks represented both an effort to warn Syria’s government of the consequences of using its chemical arsenal and to signal support for Israel, the main point of his trip there.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Showing solidarity with Israel’s growing concern about chemical weapons in neighboring Syria, President Obama stated bluntly on Wednesday that if an investigation he had ordered found proof that the Syrian military had used such weapons it would be a “game changer” in American involvement in the civil war there.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Rick Gladstone

articles.headline: ‘Tonight,’ With New Host, Set to Reclaim Its New York Roots
articles.snippet: An always-fractious changing of the guard on the late-night show will this time be accompanied by a change of scenery.
articles.abstract: An always-fractious changing of the guard on the late-night show will this time be accompanied by a change of scenery.
articles.lead_paragraph: NBC has settled on two new stars for “The Tonight Show”: Jimmy Fallon and New York City.

articles.headline: New Reasons to Change Light Bulbs
articles.snippet: LED bulbs last longer and use less power than older ones, and with prices falling, a change makes even more sense.
articles.abstract: LED bulbs last longer and use less power than older ones, and with prices falling, a change makes even more sense.
articles.lead_paragraph: People sometimes have trouble making small sacrifices now that will reward them handsomely later. How often do we ignore the advice to make a few diet and exercise changes to live a longer, healthier life? Or to put some money aside to grow into a nest egg? Intellectually, we get it — but instant gratification is a powerful force.

articles.headline: Profit Down 31%, FedEx Cuts Outlook
articles.snippet: In an effort to reduce costs, FedEx said it would retire some older and less efficient airplanes.
articles.abstract: In an effort to reduce costs, FedEx said it would retire some older and less efficient airplanes.
articles.lead_paragraph: Express shipping seems much less urgent these days.

articles.headline: A Building Boom as Chinese Art Rises in Stature
articles.snippet: China is opening museums on a surreal scale, but the country is still sorting out what exactly it wants from them.
articles.abstract: China is opening museums on a surreal scale, but the country is still sorting out what exactly it wants from them.
articles.lead_paragraph: After years of fevered activity, museum building and expansion in the United States have slowed to a crawl under a low-lying economic cloud. In Europe, where the climate is even stormier, venerable state-financed institutions go begging for cash.

articles.headline: The Lens Rises in Stature
articles.snippet: Museums — many of them with new photography department heads — are organizing exhibitions that in some cases incorporate other art media.
articles.abstract: Museums — many of them with new photography department heads — are organizing exhibitions that in some cases incorporate other art media.
articles.lead_paragraph: ON a recent wintry afternoon, Jeff Rosenheim, the newly appointed head of the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s photography department, stopped in at its special exhibition galleries. He was checking on the installation of a new acquisition: a 61-minute video called “Street,” by the British-born artist James Nares.

articles.headline: Afghan Villagers Take On Taliban in Their Heartland
articles.snippet: An uprising in Panjwai has spread through dozens of other villages in southern Afghanistan, in the most significant popular turning against the Islamist insurgents in recent years.
articles.abstract: An uprising in Panjwai has spread through dozens of other villages in southern Afghanistan, in the most significant popular turning against the Islamist insurgents in recent years.
articles.lead_paragraph: PISHIN GAN SAYEDAN, Afghanistan — An uprising against the Taliban that began last month in this southern Afghan village has now spread through dozens of others, according to residents and Afghan and American officials, in the most significant popular turning against the Islamist insurgents in recent years.

articles.headline: Neurosurgeon’s Speeches Have Conservatives Dreaming of 2016
articles.snippet: Dr. Benjamin Carson has been embraced by Republicans as a dream candidate after he publicly criticized President Obama over the health care overhaul.
articles.abstract: Dr. Benjamin Carson has been embraced by Republicans as a dream candidate after he publicly criticized President Obama over the health care overhaul.
articles.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — Dr. Benjamin Carson was a political unknown just weeks ago.

articles.headline: The Face of Future Health Care
articles.snippet: Although Kaiser Permanente is considered an example of the future of health care, its chief acknowledges that it has not been able to deliver that care at a low enough cost.
articles.abstract: Although Kaiser Permanente is considered an example of the future of health care, its chief acknowledges that it has not been able to deliver that care at a low enough cost.
articles.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. — When people talk about the future of health care, Kaiser Permanente is often the model they have in mind.

articles.headline: Obama Urges Young Israelis to Lead the Push for Peace
articles.snippet: President Obama moved closer to Israel’s position on resuming stalled peace talks with the Palestinians, even as he passionately implored a young audience to get ahead of its own leaders.
articles.abstract: President Obama moved closer to Israel’s position on resuming stalled peace talks with the Palestinians, even as he passionately implored a young audience to get ahead of its own leaders.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — President Obama, appealing to very disparate audiences to solve one of the world’s thorniest problems, moved closer on Thursday to the Israeli government’s position on resuming long-stalled peace talks with the Palestinians, even as he passionately implored young Israelis to get ahead of their own leaders in the push for peace.

articles.headline: Mood Darkens in Cyprus as Deadline Is Set for Bailout
articles.snippet: Cypriots flocked to cash machines as the European Central Bank said it would shut off low-cost bank financing if an accord is not reached by Monday.
articles.abstract: Cypriots flocked to cash machines as the European Central Bank said it would shut off low-cost bank financing if an accord is not reached by Monday.
articles.lead_paragraph: NICOSIA, Cyprus — As the European Central Bank threatened to shut off crucial financing for banks in Cyprus without a rapid accord on an international bailout, members of Parliament put off a vote on Thursday on yet another revamped formula. The vote was rescheduled for Friday.
